game.title: Chess game rules
game.subTitle: Base rules
game.gameRules: The game of chess is played on a board of 64 squares, alternately light and dark, called the white and black squares. Each player starts the game with 16 pieces: one king, one queen, two rooks, two bishops, two knights, and eight pawns.
game.endGameRules: The game ends when a player checkmates the opponent's king, which means that the king is threatened with capture without any possibility of escape, or if one of the players declares a draw.

king.name: The King
king.desc: One square per move in all directions.

queen.name: The Queen
queen.desc: It can move vertically, horizontally, and diagonally without any limit on the number of squares.

bishop.name: Bishop
bishop.desc: It can move diagonally according to the color defined at the beginning of the game and without any limit on the number of squares.

knight.name: Knight
knight.desc:
Moves in an L-shape in different ways:
-Two squares horizontally or vertically and one square in the perpendicular direction.
-One square horizontally or vertically and two squares in the perpendicular direction.

rook.name: Rook
rook.desc: Can move horizontally or vertically in all directions without limit of number of squares.

pawn.name: Pawn
pawn.desc:
Moves one square forward at a time.
Moves two squares forward on its first move.
Moves one square diagonally to capture opponent's piece.
